# Tutorials Docs

## Tutorials

- [Explore record types](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/csharp/tutorials/records.md): Learn about how to use record types, build hierarchies of records, and when to choose records over classes.
- [Explore top-level statements](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/csharp/tutorials/top-level-statements.md): This tutorial shows how you can use top-level statements to experiment and prove concepts while exploring your ideas
- [Explore indexes and ranges](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/csharp/tutorials/ranges-indexes.md): This advanced tutorial teaches you to explore data using indices and ranges to examine a continuous range of a sequential data set.
- [Work with nullable reference types](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/csharp/tutorials/nullable-reference-types.md): This advanced tutorial provides an introduction to nullable reference types. You learn to express your design intent on when reference values might be null, and have the compiler enforce when they can't be null.
- [Explore patterns in objects](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/csharp/tutorials/patterns-objects.md): This tutorial teaches you techniques to use pattern matching in class members to create better models for object behavior
- [String interpolation](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/csharp/tutorials/string-interpolation.md): Learn how to include formatted expression results in a result string in C# with string interpolation.
- [Console Application](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/csharp/tutorials/console-teleprompter.md): This tutorial teaches you a number of features in .NET Core and the C# language.
- [REST Client](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/csharp/tutorials/console-webapiclient.md): Learn how to make HTTP requests to a REST web service and deserialize JSON responses. This tutorial creates a .NET console and uses C#.
- [Work with LINQ](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/csharp/tutorials/working-with-linq.md): This tutorial teaches you how to generate sequences with LINQ, write methods for use in LINQ queries, and distinguish between eager and lazy evaluation.
